answerText: Heart of a Dog[10] This author of Heart of a Dog was subject to heavy censorship from the Soviet government; consequently, his The Master and Margarita was not published until twenty-six years after his death.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Rice A + Columbia A | 20 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this novel, Philip Philipovich Preobrazhensky and his student Bormenthal engage in ethically questionable medical procedures.  For 10 points each: [10] Name this satire in which Sharik, after undergoing surgery, takes on the name Polygraph Polygraphovich Sharikov and proceeds to terrorize Dr. Preobrazhensky's household.
